header: For I Did Not Want My Coming To Cause You Grief, So I Wrote To You Instead

verse: For I determined this for myself: not to come to you again in grief.
For if I grieve you, who indeed is the one cheering me except the one being grieved by me?
And I wrote this very thing in order that having come, I should not have grief from the ones of whom I ought-to-have rejoicing— having confidence in you all that my joy is the joy of you all.

header: I Wrote To You In Anguish Not To Grieve You, But Out of Love For You

verse: For I wrote to you through many tears, out of much affliction and anguish of heart— not that you might be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have especially for you.
But if anyone has caused-grief, he has grieved not me, but in part (that I not be a burden), you all.
This punishment by the majority is sufficient for such a one,
so that on-the-contrary, instead you should forgive and comfort him, that such a one should not somehow be swallowed-up by more grief.
Therefore I urge you to confirm your love for him.

header: I Also Wrote To Test Your Obedience To God

verse: For I also wrote for this purpose: that I might know your approvedness, whether you are obedient in all things.
And to whom you are forgiving anything, I also. For indeed what I have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, is for your sakes in the presence of Christ,
in order that we may not be exploited by Satan. For we are not unaware as to his schemes.

header: So Instead I Went To Macedonia First To Find Titus

verse: Now having come to Troas for the good-news of Christ, and a door having been opened for me by the Lord,
I had no rest in my spirit at my not finding Titus my brother. But having said-goodbye to them, I went forth to Macedonia.

header: I Praise God That He Is Always Spreading The Aroma of Christ Through Us Everywhere

verse: But thanks be to God, the One always leading us in triumph in Christ, and making the aroma of  the knowledge of Him known through us in every place.
Because we are the fragrance of Christ for God among the ones being saved, and among the ones perishing—
to the ones an aroma from death to death, but to the others an aroma from life to life. And who is sufficient for these things?
For we are not like the many peddling the word of God. But as from purity, but as from God, we are speaking in Christ before God.
